testCases.description: Test that messages can be created with username and content, and have valid timestamps

testScript.text:
1. Create a new Message object with username 'alice' and content 'Hello, World!'
2. Verify that msg.username equals 'alice'
3. Verify that msg.content equals 'Hello, World!'
4. Verify that msg.timestamp is not zero

testCases.gherkin:
Given a message is created with username and content
When the message is instantiated
Then it should have valid username, content, and timestamp

testCases.description: Test that messages can be converted to string format correctly

testScript.text:
1. Create a Message object with username 'bob' and content 'Test message'
2. Call msg.toString()
3. Verify the string contains 'bob @ Test message | '
4. Verify the string contains a valid timestamp format

testCases.gherkin:
Given a message object
When toString is called
Then it should return properly formatted string with timestamp

testCases.description: Test that messages can be parsed from string format correctly

testScript.text:
1. Create a string 'charlie @ Hello there | 2024-03-20 15:30:00'
2. Call Message::fromString(input)
3. Verify msg.username equals 'charlie'
4. Verify msg.content equals 'Hello there'
5. Verify timestamp matches expected time

testCases.gherkin:
Given a properly formatted message string
When fromString is called
Then it should parse username, content, and timestamp correctly

testCases.description: Test that invalid message strings throw appropriate exceptions

testScript.text:
1. Create an invalid input string 'invalid format'
2. Call Message::fromString(invalid_input)
3. Verify that std::runtime_error is thrown

testCases.gherkin:
Given an invalid message string format
When fromString is called
Then it should throw runtime_error exception

testCases.description: Test that message timestamps are updated when content changes

testScript.text:
1. Create a Message object
2. Record initial timestamp
3. Wait 1 second
4. Update message content using setContent()
5. Verify new timestamp is greater than initial timestamp

testCases.gherkin:
Given a message with initial timestamp
When content is updated
Then timestamp should be updated to current time
